chapter_title: 8. If forced to fight in a salt-marsh, you should have
claims: If forced to fight in a salt-marsh, you should have water and grass near you, and get your back to a clump of trees.
In dry, level country, take up an easily accessible position with rising ground to your right and on your rear, so that the danger may be in front, and safety lie behind.
rules: All armies prefer high ground to low and sunny places to dark.
If you are careful of your men, and camp on hard ground, the army will be free from disease of every kind, and this will spell victory.
When you come to a hill or a bank, occupy the sunny side, with the slope on your right rear.
warnings: If you wish to ford a swollen river, wait until it subsides.
